text.title: Adaptive Threshold-Aided K-Best Sphere Decoding for Large MIMO Systems

p.s:
The proposed AKSD and the conventional KSD were tested with various values of
K
for comparison .
The improved K-best SD ( IKSD ) algorithm was also considered for comparison .
In , three threshold rules were proposed , namely , the adaptive , normalized , and fixed thresholds .
In this study , for comparison , we tested the adaptive threshold-based IKSD and the fixed threshold-based IKSD .
In addition , the schemes in were tested for comparison .

The radius adaptive
K
-best decoder ( RAKSD ) in employs tree decomposition and adaptive pruning to reduce the complexity , whereas the dynamic threshold-aided
K
-best sphere decoder ( DKSD ) in exploits a dynamic threshold to adjust
K
.

The complexity was measured by the average number of visited nodes .
Furthermore , the mean values in the simulation results were obtained by averaging over independent channel realizations .
